title: 3D Perception & AR Systems
description: My research in 3D perception focuses on scalable object understanding for AR and cross-reality systems under real-world constraints. This includes robust geometric reasoning, object localization, and system-level deployment considerations for multi-user environments.
keyIdeas: Scalable 3D object detection for shared AR cloud experiences
Amodal and geometry-aware perception for object-centric reasoning
Production-oriented vision pipelines for reliability in deployment
representativePublications: Multi-user, scalable 3D object detection in AR cloud (CVPR Workshop on Computer Vision for Augmented and Virtual Reality, 2020)
Scalable three-dimensional object recognition in a cross reality system (US Patent 11,704,806, 2023)
Object recognition neural network for amodal center prediction (US Patent 11,989,900, 2024)
systemsImpact: Advanced shared AR object understanding for cross-reality scenarios
Improved perception robustness for deployment-facing 3D systems

title: Multimodal Foundation Models
description: My current work centers on multimodal foundation models, with emphasis on efficient vision-language learning and robust representation quality. I focus on methods that improve transfer, training efficiency, and practical usability in large-scale product systems.
keyIdeas: Large-scale multimodal pretraining and model-card-driven evaluation
Efficient vision-language understanding via grounded QFormer designs
representativePublications: The Amazon Nova Family of Models: Technical Report and Model Card (arXiv:2506.12103, 2025)
Platonic Grounding for Efficient Multimodal Language Models (arXiv:2504.19327, 2025)
Avoiding spurious correlations via logit correction (arXiv:2212.01433, 2022)
systemsImpact: Contributed to multimodal model quality and capability improvements in Amazon Nova workstreams
Improved efficiency and robustness characteristics of deployed multimodal learning pipelines

title: AI in Imaging & Multimodal Interaction
description: I have also worked on medically grounded 3D imaging representations and multimodal human-centered modeling. This line of work combines data fidelity, semantic understanding, and behavior-aware modeling for perception-heavy applications.
keyIdeas: Efficient octree representations for high-fidelity 3D medical imaging
Style-aware motion generation for interactive multimodal systems
representativePublications: Octree representation improves data fidelity of cardiac CT images and CNN segmentation (Radiology: Artificial Intelligence, 2021)
Topic and style-aware transformer for multimodal emotion recognition (Findings of ACL, 2023)
Listening Style-Aware Dyadic Facial Motion Generation (STRL@IJCAI, 2023)
systemsImpact: Improved segmentation fidelity in 3D cardiac imaging tasks
Expanded multimodal interaction modeling for expressive and behavior-aware AI
